big_picture_notes: Zechariah divides into two distinct halves. Chapters 1–8 are dated encouragement oracles centered on a cycle of eight night visions (chs. 1–6), capped by a crowning sign‑act and followed by prose oracles on fasting and future blessing (chs. 7–8). Chapters 9–14 shift to undated, apocalyptic 'burdens' (maśśāʾ) marked by oracle formulas (9:1; 12:1), focusing on judgment/salvation, the humble king, shepherd imagery, repentance/cleansing, and the climactic Day of Yahweh. Literary glue: dating formulas, the interpreting angel motif, repeated 'Thus says Yahweh of hosts,' and the burden/oracle markers framing the second half.

stories.story_title: The Eight Night Visions and the Temple's Hope
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: A dated sequence beginning with introductory repentance (1:1–6) and night visions (from 1:7) through the crowning sign‑act (6:9–15). Start (1:1): first date/oracle establishes context. End (6:15): conditional promise that the temple will be built by those from afar—vision cycle resolved. Glue: 'I lifted up my eyes and saw' vision markers, the interpreting angel refrain, restoration/cleansing themes.

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Dated oracle recalls fathers’ disobedience and justice fulfilled; closes with acknowledgment that Yahweh’s words overtook them. Devices: exhortation, retrospective validation.
Second date; patrol report of earth at rest; divine zeal for Zion and promise of comfort. Devices: dialogue with interpreting angel and Angel of Yahweh; compassion motif.

scenes.scene_name: Vision of the Four Horns and Four Smiths
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Horns that scattered Judah; smiths sent to terrify and cast them down. Devices: symbolic agents, terse Q&A interpretation.
Man with measuring line; Jerusalem without walls with Yahweh as fiery wall; call to flee Babylon; ends with 'Be silent, all flesh.' Devices: measurement/ownership, glory‑presence, prophetic summons.

scenes.scene_name: Vision of Joshua the High Priest
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Courtroom cleansing of Joshua; filthy garments replaced; Branch introduced; ends with peace under vine/fig tree. Devices: legal drama, reversal/cleansing, priestly vindication.

scenes.scene_name: Vision of the Lampstand and Two Olive Trees
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Angel awakens prophet; golden lampstand fed by two olives; 'Not by might... but by my Spirit'; Zerubbabel assured completion. Devices: symbol interpretation, programmatic oracle, two anointed ones.
Cursing scroll flies over land to consume houses of thieves and perjurers. Devices: written curse as active agent; covenant sanctions.

scenes.scene_name: Vision of the Woman in the Basket (Ephah)
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Wickedness personified confined in ephah and borne to Shinar; removal of impurity. Devices: personification, exile/purification motif.
Four chariots/spirits go out; north country pacified. Devices: parallel to opening patrol, universal reach of Yahweh’s agency.
Word commands symbolic crowning of Joshua; Branch will build the temple; those far off will build if obedient. Devices: sign‑act, messianic Branch, conditional promise.

stories.story_title: The Question of Fasting and the Future of Zion
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: A dated prose unit responding to fasting inquiry: indicts past self‑serving ritual (7) and promises restoration/ethics and feast‑reversal (8). Start (7:1): fourth‑year date. End (8:23): nations grasp a Jew’s robe—God is with you. Glue: inclusio around fasting (7:3; 8:18–19) and repeated 'Thus says Yahweh of hosts.'

scenes.scene_name: Inquiry on Fasting and Past Obedience
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Date and question posed; Yahweh asks whether past fasting was for Him and recalls neglect of former prophets. Devices: rhetorical questions, historical allusion.
Call to justice/mercy refused; hearts like diamond; result is scattering among nations. Devices: cause‑effect oracle, hardening imagery.
'Thus says Yahweh of hosts' multiplied; jealousy for Zion; old and young in streets; covenant formula restored. Devices: oath formulas, peace tableau.
'Let your hands be strong'; reversal from no wage/peace to fruitful vine/peaceful conditions. Devices: contrastive parallelism, builder exhortation.

scenes.scene_name: Ethical Mandates for the Restored Community
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: From purposed disaster to purposed good; speak truth, judge peace; Yahweh hates falsehood. Devices: purpose chiasm, concise ethics.
Fasts of months become joyful feasts; nations seek Yahweh in Jerusalem; ten men grasp a Jew’s robe. Devices: reversal motif, synecdoche for universal pilgrimage.

stories.story_title: The First Burden: Judgment, the Lowly King, and the Worthless Shepherd
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Undated apocalyptic burden beginning at 9:1; moves from neighbor judgments to humble king (9:9–10), covenant‑victory and restoration, then allegory of shepherd and broken staffs. Start (9:1): burden formula. End (11:17): woe on the worthless shepherd—unit closure. Glue: shepherd/covenant motifs and swift progression from hope to rejection.

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Geographic sweep (Damascus→Philistia); Yahweh encamps to guard His house. Devices: personification, city list oracle, protection assurance.
'Rejoice greatly' summons; king on a donkey; ends with worldwide peace and dominion. Devices: contrastive royal imagery, messianic proclamation.
Blood of covenant frees prisoners; divine warrior imagery; closes with abundance and beauty. Devices: covenant language, martial theophany, praise.

scenes.scene_name: Call for Rain and Divine Leadership
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Ask Yahweh for rain; reject diviners; cornerstone/tent‑peg/battle‑bow metaphors for leadership. Devices: polemic against false counsel, leadership metaphors.

scenes.scene_name: Gathering the Scattered and Restoring Israel
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Strengthen Judah/save Joseph; whistle for them; return from Egypt/Assyria; walk in His name. Devices: regathering motif, repetition, covenant walk.
'Open your doors, O Lebanon' lament; cedars devoured; shepherds wail. Devices: personification, hyperbole, transitional lament.
Prophet becomes shepherd; two staffs (Grace/Union) broken; 30 pieces of silver thrown; woe on worthless shepherd. Devices: extended sign‑act, ironic valuation, curse oracle.

stories.story_title: The Second Burden: Mourning, Cleansing, and Final Battle
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Second burden (12:1) weaves mourning for the pierced one, cleansing, end of idols/false prophets, striking/refining of shepherded remnant, and the climactic Day of Yahweh with universal holiness. Start (12:1): burden formula. End (14:21): no Canaanite/trader in Yahweh’s house—absolute holiness. Glue: repeated 'on that day' stitching the apocalyptic tapestry.

scenes.scene_name: Jerusalem: Cup of Trembling and Immovable Rock
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Jerusalem burdens nations; Yahweh strengthens and seeks to destroy attackers. Devices: warfare metaphors, escalating defense promises.

scenes.scene_name: Mourning for the Pierced One and Cleansing
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Spirit poured out; they look on the pierced; deep lament; fountain opened for sin and impurity. Devices: lament genre, repentance‑to‑cleansing arc.

scenes.scene_name: End of Idolatry and False Prophets
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Names of idols cut off; prophets ashamed/deny prophetic identity; wounds explained away. Devices: purification oracle, shame/denial motif.

scenes.scene_name: Striking the Shepherd and Refining the Remnant
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: 'Awake, O sword' against my shepherd; two‑thirds cut; one‑third refined; covenant exchange restored. Devices: shepherd/flock metaphor, refining imagery.

scenes.scene_name: The Day of the LORD: Theophany and Split Mountain
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Final apocalyptic event; Yahweh stands on Mount of Olives; unique day ends with light. Devices: theophany narrative, cosmic upheaval.
Waters flow from Jerusalem; Yahweh king over all; plague on enemy armies. Devices: water symbolism, kingship proclamation, plague imagery.
Survivors keep Feast of Booths; bells and pots 'Holy to Yahweh'; no Canaanite in Yahweh’s house. Devices: cultic imagery, holiness inclusio, universal worship.
